column4: AFAIK, cron is run on a per-user basis, including the root user. So root programs should be in root crontab and user programs in user crontab

You should recognize what commands should be run as user and which to be run as root. Rule of thumb is, you should always know why you need to run a command with superuser privileges before running it. Otherwise, always use user
In addition to security issues, running user commands as root can potentially cause permissions issues
Like I said, you should understand why any command needs to be run as root and that includes scripts
